Column Comment.0: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.1: DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number for the detail about theconsequnce or result of the incident. A list of things that happened.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: REFERENCE INCIDENT DETAIL: The details about the incident, such as specificthings that happened. Each thing that happened should be tracked at the levelnecessary for reporting and analysis.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: INCIDENT DATE: The date that this portion of an incident began.
Column Comment.7: INCIDENT DURATION: The amount of time that this component of the incidentcontinued, usually measured in secords, minutes, hours or days.
Column Comment.10: INCIDENT SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set of incident types that may bemandated by an operating company, regulatory agency or contract.
Column Comment.11: HSE INCIDENT SEVERITY: ID for the severity of an actual incident, usuallymeasured with a scale specific to the kind of incidents. For example, a vehicleincident could be an unsafe action, a near miss, or a hit. Incidents can be rated asminor, moderate or severe or according to any scale necessary.
Column Comment.12: INCIDENT TYPE: The type of indicent that may have occurred, such as roll-over, orexplosion, or unsafe materials handling.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
